You will report to our Head of Engineering, who will support you as a senior sparring partner for technical decisions, reviews, and escalation.

Your Mission

‚Ä¢ Partner with customer stakeholders to understand workflows, constraints, and goals, then translate them into a clear technical plan.

‚Ä¢ Identify relevant data sources across established system landscapes (ERP/MES/PLM, spreadsheets, databases), clarify access paths, and move from assumptions to usable inputs.

‚Ä¢ Extend SPREAD‚Äôs info-model when needed (GraphQL schema), keeping solutions reusable beyond a single engagement.

‚Ä¢ Build data mappings and integration flows with our internal ETL/mapping tooling (nextgen-xmap), turning cross-system references into maintainable pipelines.

‚Ä¢ Deliver user-facing solutions in two ways, depending on what the situation needs:

‚Ä¢ Rapidly via low-code when speed is the best lever

‚Ä¢ Via custom UI in TypeScript/React when the use case calls for it

‚Ä¢ Communicate progress and trade-offs clearly with Product, Value Realization, and Engineering. Surface risks early and ask for the right support.

‚Ä¢ Travel occasionally to customer sites when it meaningfully improves discovery, alignment, or rollout.

‚Ä¢ Package your outcomes so they can scale, including solid documentation, clean structure, and a handover-ready setup for engineering follow-through.

Your Experience

Must-have

‚Ä¢ 4+ years of engineering experience delivering software in real-world environments, including ambiguity, constraints, and deadlines.

‚Ä¢ Strong hands-on skills in JavaScript or TypeScript and React.

‚Ä¢ Ability to write complex SQL confidently, including joins, aggregations, window functions, and performance-aware querying, to explore and validate enterprise data.

‚Ä¢ Practical understanding of ETL and data integration fundamentals, including mapping, transformation, validation, and how source data becomes something a UI can rely on.

‚Ä¢ Comfort in customer-facing settings: you listen well, ask sharp questions, and explain technical choices clearly to different audiences.

‚Ä¢ Delivery mindset and ownership: you scope, iterate, and get to a working outcome.

Strong plus

‚Ä¢ GraphQL experience, or the ability to pick it up quickly if you are strong in SQL and schema thinking.

‚Ä¢ Exposure to low-code and AI tooling, and you genuinely enjoy building this way.

‚Ä¢ Experience navigating established enterprise systems and complex data landscapes (SAP, Oracle, custom databases, multi-team ownership).

Why SPREAD?

‚Ä¢ Build customer-facing solutions at an AI-first company where shipping value is the baseline, and where platform leverage grows with every successful delivery.

‚Ä¢ Work at the intersection of product, engineering, and customer teams with the freedom to shape approach, scope, and implementation.

‚Ä¢ Make measurable impact in complex enterprise environments, where integrated data and usable applications directly change how teams operate.

‚Ä¢ Strong overall package including attractive compensation, mobility budget (Deutschlandticket), Urban Sports partnership, 30 vacation days, workation options, a volunteering day, and an annual learning budget.

Contact

Dmytro ƒ∞efymenko

K√∂penicker Str. 40c | 10179 Berlin

title: Enterprise Account Executive - DACH
description:
This role is located in Munich, Germany - We are a hybrid work environment and are in the office 3+ days/per week.

Tulip, the leader in AI-native frontline operations, is helping companies around the world equip their workforce with composable, connected apps, leading to higher quality work, improved efficiency, and end-to-end traceability across operations. Tulip's cloud-native, no-code platform, powered by embedded AI, is driving the digital transformation of industrial environments through composable, human-centric solutions that go beyond disrupting the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) category.

A spinoff out of MIT, Tulip is headquartered in Somerville, MA, with offices in Germany, Hungary, Singapore, and Israel. Tulip has been recognized as a World Economic Forum Global Innovator, a 2024 Deloitte Technology Fast award winner, one of Energage's Top Workplaces USA, and one of Built In Boston's "Best Places to Work" and "Best Midsize Places to Work."

This is an impactful role playing a foundational part in establishing and rapidly scaling Tulip's commercial presence across the DACH region (Germany, Austria, and Switzerland). Designed for a high-impact seller motivated by building a region and shaping its future structure, you will operate with a high degree of autonomy, working entrepreneurially to define the go-to-market strategy, build pipeline, and own new business and strategic enterprise accounts end-to-end. Beyond direct customer engagement, the role involves developing and activating strategic partnerships with leading technology providers and global consulting firms to accelerate enterprise adoption and regional scale, requiring a proactive, self-starting approach.

About You:

‚Ä¢ You are a hunter and closer with experience selling SaaS solutions into manufacturing environments

‚Ä¢ You are motivated by ownership and impact, and excited by the opportunity to build a region from the ground up

‚Ä¢ You have thrived in scale-up or growth-stage environments, selling complex, high-value software

‚Ä¢ You are comfortable operating without fully defined processes‚Äîand enjoy helping to create them

‚Ä¢ You think clearly and confidently in complex or ambiguous situations

‚Ä¢ You are intellectually curious, humble, and commercially sharp

‚Ä¢ You care deeply about customers and partners, and lead with listening and learning

‚Ä¢ You are not afraid to roll up your sleeves and work across large, multi-stakeholder deals

slug_title: associate manager global courier pricing berlin
title: Associate Manager, Global Courier Pricing
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
We are seeking an Associate Manager to join our Global Courier Pricing team. In this role, you will help develop and execute Wolt's courier pricing strategy, acting as the vital link between product innovation and operational performance.¬†

Your core mission will be to deploy new product developments into our pricing engine to enhance the courier experience of the pricing bidding process. You will be responsible for balancing courier satisfaction with key company metrics, specifically optimising for Task Acceptance Rate (TAR) and Speed of Acceptance. This is a hands-on opportunity to translate product designs into measurable impact across Wolt's markets.¬†

What you'll be doing

‚Ä¢ Drive Implementations: Drive the global rollout of new product features and pricing developments across all Wolt markets.

‚Ä¢ Data-Driven Sparring: Act as an analytical partner for teams designing new pricing schemes, ensuring they are optimised for performance.

‚Ä¢ Bridge Product & Operations: Partner closely with Product teams to translate operational inefficiencies into technical solutions.

‚Ä¢ Influence the Roadmap: Ensure the product development cycle is focused on solving structural friction points to improve long-term scalability.

Our humble expectations

‚Ä¢ Analytically Strong: Proficient in data analysis and able to leverage data and AI to drive precision in pricing and operational KPIs.

‚Ä¢ Structural Thinker: A natural problem-solver who excels at identifying root causes and systemic inefficiencies within complexity.

‚Ä¢ Tech-Savvy Collaborator: Skilled at bridging the gap between operational needs and product development.

‚Ä¢ Outcome Focused: You take ownership of the "last mile" of implementation and thrive on seeing features making an impact at scale.

‚Ä¢ Effective Communicator: A reliable sparring partner who can translate complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations for any stakeholder. Fluent English skills in both written and spoken form is required.¬†

What we offer

‚Ä¢ Fast Paced Enviroment: Work in a fast-scaling environment with ambitious peers and a strong bias towards action.

‚Ä¢ Leverage Great Tech & Data: We have world-class tools for rapid data and reliable analysis experimentation.

‚Ä¢ Dedicated Team: You will be working closely with an experienced team member to ensure a smooth and successful entry.

‚Ä¢ Global Impact: Directly own and scale product implementations across all Wolt markets worldwide.

Next steps¬†

Join a high-growth company where you actually get to build the engine, not just drive it. You'll work with an ambitious team where the learning curve is steep and the impact is global. If this sounds like the challenge you've been waiting for, we'd love to hear from you! We will be reviewing applications on an on-going basis, so apply today! Please remember to submit your resume in English.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Working Student (f/m/d)* IT Security
description:
Would you like to join us as a Working Student (f/m/d)* IT Security? Apply to become part of our journey!

With the power of a globally successful brand, we at Engel & V√∂lkers are setting new standards and, together with our international colleagues, driving forward first-class services and creative solutions. At Engel & V√∂lkers, you'll work independently from day one with plenty of creative freedom to contribute new ideas and realize projects. Together, we are shaping a corporate culture that fosters personal growth and an innovative mindset.

To support our Tech Security Team at the Hamburg Headquarters, we are looking for you as a Working Student (f/m/d)* IT Security (20 hours/ week) with immediate effect. Our Tech Security Team takes care of all IT security issues. This involves identifying and remedying vulnerabilities as well as supporting users with security topics. The team is constantly developing IT security within the company and the Group.

Tasks, that let you grow

‚Ä¢ You contribute to the development and optimization of detection rules and automated playbooks.

‚Ä¢ You help improve internal IT security processes, response workflows, and overall incident management practices.

‚Ä¢ You support the maintenance and monitoring of our endpoint protection system and collaborate closely with your colleagues to reduce IT security risks.

Your skills that inspire us

‚Ä¢ You are currently enrolled in either a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs program in the domain of IT, Computer Science, IT Security, or a related field.

‚Ä¢ You have gained initial practical experience in the area of cybersecurity/ IT security.

An environment that empowers you

title: Data Analyst
description:
ResearchPod is building the audio gateway to cutting-edge research. We transform dense academic papers into clear, engaging 10-minute podcast episodes, making the latest discoveries in AI, biology, physics, medicine, and beyond accessible to students, researchers, scientists, and lifelong learners. Powered by AI that learns each user‚Äôs interests, ResearchPod delivers personalized feeds that fit seamlessly into commutes, workouts, or focused study sessions. We‚Äôre a fast-moving, mission-driven startup starting with user-uploaded PDFs and rapidly scaling toward a comprehensive library, interactive voice features, and institutional partnerships. Join us to democratize knowledge and help millions stay ahead of the research frontier.

Tasks

‚Ä¢ Own the full analytics stack: track user acquisition, engagement, retention, and monetization metrics across free and premium tiers.

‚Ä¢ Deep-dive into listening behavior to quantify what makes an episode ‚Äúgreat‚Äù and how personalization impacts completion rates, repeat usage, and subscription conversion.

‚Ä¢ Build and maintain dashboards (we use tools like Amplitude, Mixpanel, Snowflake, dbt, and Looker/Tableau) that product, growth, and leadership rely on daily.

‚Ä¢ Design and analyze A/B tests for recommendation algorithms, paywalls, onboarding flows, and content discovery features.

‚Ä¢ Partner closely with engineering and product to instrument new events, define KPIs for upcoming features (e.g., voice interaction mode, visual explainers), and surface actionable insights.

‚Ä¢ Identify leading indicators of churn, virality, and LTV; propose and validate interventions.

‚Ä¢ Help shape our data warehouse and establish best practices as we transition from startup chaos to scalable infrastructure.

Requirements

‚Ä¢ 3‚Äì6 years of hands-on analytics experience, ideally at a consumer tech or edtech company.

‚Ä¢ Advanced SQL skills (you write clean, efficient queries on large datasets).

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Python or R for analysis and scripting; experience with dbt is a strong plus.

‚Ä¢ Comfortable with product analytics platforms (Amplitude, Mixpanel, Heap) and visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Mode).

‚Ä¢ Strong statistical foundation and rigorous approach to experimentation and causal inference.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communicator who can translate complex findings into clear recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Genuine curiosity about user behavior and a bias toward action‚Äîearly-stage environment means you‚Äôll wear multiple hats and ship insights quickly.

‚Ä¢ Bonus: experience with recommendation systems, audio/content platforms, or freemium monetization.

Benefits

‚Ä¢ Direct impact: your analyses will shape product roadmap, pricing, and growth strategy at a critical inflection point.

‚Ä¢ High ownership: small team, big problems, no bureaucracy.

‚Ä¢ Mission that matters: help democratize access to research and accelerate scientific progress.

‚Ä¢ Competitive salary, meaningful equity, flexible remote/hybrid work, and learning budget.

title: Chief of Staff
description:
Bei VREY bauen wir das EnergyOS f√ºr Mehrfamilienh√§user.

In Deutschland stehen √ºber 3,3 Millionen Mehrparteienh√§user ‚Äì und sie sind das schwarze Loch der Energiewende. < 1% Solardurchdringung. < 2% Smart Metering. Kaum Flexibilit√§t oder intelligentes Energiemanagement.

Gleichzeitig zwingt die Regulierung Eigent√ºmer zu massiven Investitionen: Solar wird zur Pflicht, Smart Meter m√ºssen in den n√§chsten 5 Jahren fl√§chendeckend ausgerollt werden, Heizung und Mobilit√§t elektrifizieren sich. Das Mehrfamilienhaus wird vom Betongold zum aktiven Teil der dezentralen Energieinfrastruktur.

Was fehlt, ist ein integriertes System, das diesen Wandel wirtschaftlich und operativ beherrschbar macht.

VREY kombiniert zertifizierten Messstellenbetrieb mit eigener Software und erm√∂glicht Eigent√ºmern erstmals, ihren selbst erzeugten Solarstrom direkt an ihre Mieter zu verkaufen ‚Äì einfach und ohne selbst zum Energieversorger zu werden (¬ß42b EnWG).

Damit wird regulatorischer Zwang zu einer profitablen und planbaren Chance:

‚Ä¢ Zweistellige Renditen und Wertsteigerung f√ºr Eigent√ºmer,

‚Ä¢ ~20 % Stromkostenersparnis f√ºr Mieter, und

‚Ä¢ digitale Infrastruktur f√ºr Speicher, W√§rmepumpen und Flexibilit√§t.

Bereits heute betreuen wir eine dreistellige Anzahl an Projekten - darunter die gr√∂√üten Bestandshalter und Wohnungsbaugenossenschaften - in allen 16 Bundesl√§ndern. Damit geh√∂ren wir nach k√ºrzester Zeit zu den f√ºhrenden Anbietern im Markt.

Wir stehen am Anfang eines strukturellen Marktumbruchs. Wer heute die Energieinfrastruktur im Mehrfamilienhaus definiert, pr√§gt sie f√ºr Jahrzehnte. Werde Teil von VREY und baue mit uns das f√ºhrende EnergyOS.

Aufgaben

Mission der Rolle

Du arbeitest als verl√§ngerter Arm der Gr√ºnder und stellst sicher, dass strategische Priorit√§ten klar definiert, sauber umgesetzt und unternehmensweit ausgerichtet sind.

Dein Ziel: Fokus, Geschwindigkeit und Struktur in ein schnell wachsendes Unternehmen zu bringen und VREY auf die n√§chste Skalierungsstufe zu heben.

1. Sparringspartner der Gr√ºnder

‚Ä¢ Du strukturierst komplexe Fragestellungen und bereitest fundierte Entscheidungsgrundlagen vor

‚Ä¢ Du √ºbersetzt Vision und Strategie in konkrete Roadmaps und operative Ziele

‚Ä¢ Du challengst Annahmen, identifizierst Risiken und sorgst f√ºr klare Priorisierung

2. Steuerung unternehmenskritischer Initiativen

‚Ä¢ Du √ºbernimmst Ownership f√ºr bereichs√ºbergreifende Schl√ºsselprojekte (z. B. neue Gesch√§ftsmodelle, Organisationsdesign, Fundraising-Vorbereitung)

‚Ä¢ Du stellst die strukturierte und fristgerechte Umsetzung strategischer Initiativen sicher

‚Ä¢ Du identifizierst Engp√§sse fr√ºhzeitig und l√∂st kritische Themen mit hoher Eigenverantwortung

3. Organisationsentwicklung & Performance-Management

‚Ä¢ Du hilfst beim Aufbau skalierbarer Strukturen, Entscheidungsprozesse und Reporting-Systeme

‚Ä¢ Du etablierst klare Zielsysteme (z. B. OKRs) und Performance-Transparenz

slug_title: head of growth performance marketing berlin
title: Head of Growth & Performance Marketing (f/m/x)
description:
ABOUT

BRAINEFFECT is one of the fastest-growing mind nutrition e-commerce companies in Germany. We envision a world that embraces mind nutrition and knows that feeding your mind is key to a happy and healthy life.

Our international team is ambitious. Together we are working hard to turn the food industry around with Mind Nutrition and make BRAINEFFECT the absolute Love Brand.

How do we do that? By practicing what we preach: We are focused and bring our full energy to every project with a strong results-oriented mindset. While bold goals and growth drive us, we also recognize the importance of balance and recovery to maintain a sustainable pace. Above all - we actually look forward to Monday mornings.

IN A NUTSHELL

We are looking for a data-oriented growth leader who knows how to scale D2C brands beyond the ‚Ç¨200k/month ad spend mark ‚Äî without losing sight of ROAS, CAC, LTV and the bigger P&L picture.

As our Head of Growth & Performance Marketing, you take ownership of paid growth across our markets. You lead and develop your team, break through scaling plateaus, bring clarity to ambiguity, and turn creative insights into high-converting campaigns.

You report directly to our CMO and act as the bridge between Data, Creative, Finance, and Logistics. If you think in funnels, dream in dashboards, and treat performance dips like a personal challenge ‚Äî this one‚Äôs for you.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

‚Ä¢ You own and scale the ad budget across Meta, Google, Amazon, TikTok & emerging channels with full ROAS/CAC/LTV responsibility.

‚Ä¢ You develop a holistic cross-channel strategy where Social drives demand and Search captures it.

‚Ä¢ You stabilize and reduce CAC through systematic, high-volume creative testing frameworks.

‚Ä¢ You deep-dive into GA4 and attribution tools (e.g. Adtribute, Tracify) to model the customer journey and drive smarter budget allocation.

‚Ä¢ You build and maintain automated BI dashboards (Looker Studio or similar) and translate data into actionable insights for the C-suite.

‚Ä¢ You test and scale new growth channels together with external agencies.

‚Ä¢ You lead, mentor and challenge your team to think beyond channel silos and act as business owners.

YOUR PROFILE

‚Ä¢ 6+ years in Performance Marketing within fast-moving D2C brands, including 4+ years leading a team.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience managing 6 figure monthly ad spend with strong focus on blended performance metrics.

‚Ä¢ Deep expertise in bidding algorithms, auction dynamics, creative testing, and cross-channel attribution.

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in GA4, attribution tools, Excel/G-Sheets (Pivot, Index/Match, modeling) and Looker Studio (or similar BI tools).

‚Ä¢ Hands-on mindset: Able to independently create or iterate ads using tools like Canva, CapCut or Adobe.

‚Ä¢ Experience in DACH or FR markets, German is a plus.

‚Ä¢ Highly analytical with strong commercial acumen ‚Äî you connect channel metrics to total P&L impact.

‚Ä¢ Proactive, ownership-driven leader with strong communication skills across Data, Creative and Finance.

YOUR BENEFITS

‚Ä¢ We work in a hybrid mode (remote + office) and have flexible working hours.

‚Ä¢ We offer a company pension plan and support you with an allowance of 15%

‚Ä¢ We will subsidize your Urban Sports Club membership and lunch.

‚Ä¢ We guarantee 100% ownership, 100% trust and 0% micro management for you and your work style.

‚Ä¢ We regularly organize company lunches, yoga and sports sessions and parties.

‚Ä¢ We offer really good employee discounts on our products.

‚Ä¢ The best part: We offer our employees an annual "jobbatical" that lets you extend your vacation in the sun simply by continuing to work remotely.

HIRING PROCESS

‚Ä¢ Submit your application.

‚Ä¢ Get to know each other: In our first call, we want to exchange expectations and answer first questions. Furthermore, we would like to tell you more about BRAINEFFECT and our mission.

‚Ä¢ Meet your team-lead: Within a videocall you will meet your teamlead. Time to talk more about technical facts and the work within the department at BRAINEFFECT.

‚Ä¢ Case Study: This might be the most fun part. We will ask you to prepare a short assignment and submit your results within a given amount of time.

‚Ä¢ Office Interview: Even though it is very convenient to meet online, we would like to invite you to our office and give you the chance to get to know us in person. You will also get to know Fabian, our CEO, who can also give you some exciting facts about BRAINEFFECT and holistic mind nutrition.

‚Ä¢ Finally - Our Offer: We aim to finish the entire process as soon as possible.

You are still reading? Great, this might be the next fun challenge for you to dive in. Apply with your CV and let‚Äôs chat!

About acemate

acemate is building an AI learning & teaching platform for higher and further education institutions. We have strong traction, secured funding and are entering an exciting growth phase. We're looking for a passionate Mobile App Developer (React Native) to drive our product forward and help us scale.

Founded in 2024, acemate has quickly become the leading AI learning platform for higher and further education, trusted by top-tier institutions across four countries, including University of Cologne, WHU and the German Chambers of Commerce and Industry (IHKs).

‚Ä¢ Our Mission: Democratizing access to personalized learning. We don‚Äôt believe that AI will replace educators. Instead, we empower them to design and deliver personalized learning experiences at scale.

‚Ä¢ Our Growth: We've raised pre-seed funding and are growing rapidly. While we focus on higher and further education in the DACH area today, we're already expanding into new regions and markets.

‚Ä¢ Our Culture: We‚Äôre a young, driven team passionate about tackling the toughest challenges in education. We embrace builder culture and minimize scheduled meetings for ad-hoc discussions and maximized focus on coding and creating.

Tasks

What You'll Do

As Mobile Software Developer and a core team member, you will be a core product owner with significant influence on our mobile architecture and user experience. You will take end-to-end ownership of the systems that power our mobile features, from UI architecture and state management to API integration and performance monitoring.

‚Ä¢ Architect for scale and product value: You won‚Äôt just implement screens. You‚Äôll design scalable mobile architectures, define offline-first strategies where needed, and ensure seamless integration with our API and AI systems.

‚Ä¢ Drive technical excellence: Proactively identify performance bottlenecks, improve app startup time and responsiveness, and raise the bar for reliability, UX consistency, and maintainability.

Requirements

‚Ä¢ End-to-End Ownership: You don‚Äôt throw things over the wall. You own your features until they are running successfully in production and used by real learners.

‚Ä¢ Startup experience: You‚Äôre comfortable in fast-paced, evolving environments

‚Ä¢ Product passion: High identification with our mission to transform education

Benefits

Benefits

‚Ä¢ Flexible environment with high degree of autonomy and option to work remotely

title: Safety Engineer - ePT & Batteries (m/f/d)
description:
Are you a safety-driven engineer with a passion for electrification and breakthrough battery technologies? Do you excel at navigating complex systems, safety standards, and cutting-edge innovations? Ready to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of safe, electric off-highway machinery on a global stage? Then this is your next career move.

We‚Äôre looking for a forward-thinking Safety Engineer - ePT and Batteries to join our R&D team.

As a Safety Assurance Engineer for ePowertrain Systems and Battery Packs, you will be integral in ensuring that ELU‚Äôs (Electrification Unit of Yanmar) cutting-edge electric off-highway machines meet the highest safety standards. You will develop and implement comprehensive safety protocols and perform thorough assessments to guarantee system reliability and regulatory compliance. Working with a global team in Japan and the Netherlands, you'll guide the integration of advanced technologies, with a keen focus on both ePowertrain systems and the critical safety aspects of battery pack management. Your role will be essential in establishing Yanmar as a leader in safe and efficient off-highway electrification.

But before we tell you more about this opportunity, let us introduce ourselves !

ABOUT US

At Yanmar, we are committed to building a sustainable future. In April 2025, we launched the Electrification Unit (ELU) to lead the transformation of compact off-highway machinery through innovative zero-emission solutions. ELU focuses on developing a diverse portfolio of e-powertrain technologies, including batteries and eDrives, to electrify applications such as excavators, wheel loaders, and other industrial machinery.

Operating globally with teams in the Netherlands, Germany, and Japan, ELU leverages Yanmar's extensive resources and technical expertise to deliver efficient, reliable, and high-performance electrification solutions. Our work supports Yanmar‚Äôs broader Green Challenge 2050 initiative, reinforcing our commitment to environmental responsibility and carbon reduction.

Joining ELU means becoming part of a forward-thinking team dedicated to innovation and sustainability. Here, your contributions will have a real impact on the future of energy and the development of cleaner, more efficient machinery.

Tasks

‚Ä¢ Safety Protocol Development: Design and implement safety protocols specifically tailored for ePowertrain systems and battery packs, ensuring robust safety measures are in place.

‚Ä¢ Create safety approval process in PDM ensuring compliance with functional safety norms and targets.

‚Ä¢ Carry out error analyses (FMEA, FMEDA, and FTA).

‚Ä¢ Derive and coordinate safety concepts for Battery Management System (BMS).

‚Ä¢ Risk Assessment & Mitigation: Perform detailed risk assessments to identify potential safety issues and develop effective mitigation strategies.

‚Ä¢ Documentation & Reporting: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of safety evaluations, test results, and compliance measures.

‚Ä¢ Continuous Improvement: Continuously seek improvements in safety processes and stay informed on the latest advancements in safety technologies for electrified systems.

Requirements

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Safety Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.

‚Ä¢ At least 5 years of experience in safety assurance roles for ePowertrain systems and battery management applications.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of functional safety standards (ISO 26262, ISO 13849, IEC 61508).

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in English, both written and spoken (German or Japanese is an advantage).

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of safety standards and regulations relevant to battery technologies.

‚Ä¢ Experience in an international, cross-functional project environment.

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with cutting-edge safety technologies and methodologies for electric powertrains and battery systems.

‚Ä¢ An affinity for innovation and continuous improvement in safety practices.

Benefits

Our Culture & Values :

At ELU, our mission is clear: to support the growth of our organization by placing people at the heart of everything we do. That means understanding the challenges our employees face, exceeding expectations, and striving for excellence in every area of HR.

With a team made up of diverse backgrounds and cultures, we are an international and inclusive organization where individuality is valued and everyone is welcome. At ELU, you will be recognized for who you are and the unique contributions you bring to our team.

We are committed to fostering a workplace built on respect, equality, and collaboration. We encourage open communication, fresh ideas, and a proactive mindset. You will find an environment where you can think creatively, grow professionally, and help others do the same.

Efficiency, reliability, and innovation are not only the pillars of our products, but they are also the values that shape how we work. They drive us to continuously improve, to reach higher standards, and to learn from one another.

Our Benefits :

We believe our strength lies in the diverse talents and perspectives of our people. At ELU, we offer more than just a position, we offer a place where you can grow, thrive, and truly make a difference.

What you can expect:

‚Ä¢ A meaningful role in a forward-thinking organization,

‚Ä¢ A supportive and motivated team with a collaborative spirit,

‚Ä¢ Competitive and modern employment conditions,

‚Ä¢ And plenty of opportunities for personal and professional development.

It‚Äôs time to become part of the ELU journey‚Ä¶

Are you ready to take on an exciting challenge in a growing and evolving environment?

Apply now with your CV, we‚Äôre already looking forward to meeting you !

title: Marketing Manager | Full Time (m/w/d)
description:
Who Are We ?

üöß Picture logistics that run like clockwork ‚Äî fast, smart, and seamless.

Autonomous logistics does not start with self-driving trucks. It starts with CONROO.

At CONROO, we are building an intelligent infrastructure that drives terminals and depots towards autonomy by connecting truck drivers, terminals, and depots through continuous data flows. We replace manual and paper-based processes with real-time, data-driven workflows, turning chaos into connected systems and making truck handling fully digital.

Every step we automate today lays the foundation for terminals and depots to operate autonomously tomorrow.

We are CONROO and we are driving logistics to autonomy.

Tasks

To make all this happen, we are looking for a Marketing Manager to work closely with our Founder & CEO, Felix, and take full ownership of marketing end-to-end ‚Äî shaping our positioning and messaging while driving demand generation and measurable pipeline impact. As our first dedicated marketing hire, you‚Äôll partner closely with sales and take on a central role in driving growth and commercial success.

üéñÔ∏èWhat success looks like

In your first month

‚Ä¢ You will understand our ICP, buyer personas, and create core messaging for the global market.

‚Ä¢ You will align closely with sales to ensure clear positioning and lead quality.

‚Ä¢ You will create innovative (content, tools, ect.) and highly efficient ICP based marketing campaigns.

By 3 months

‚Ä¢ You will measure and continuously improve MQLs, SQLs, and pipeline performance.

‚Ä¢ You will create and manage key marketing assets, including landing pages, case studies, and sales materials.

‚Ä¢ You will plan and coordinate participation in industry trade fairs, and events.

By 6 months

‚Ä¢ You will build and run demand generation campaigns focused on qualified leads and pipeline impact.

‚Ä¢ You will own PR activities / Press alongside our global terminal and feature rollouts

Requirements

üöÄ What You Need to Be Successful:

‚Ä¢ You bring experience in B2B Enterprise SaaS marketing role.

‚Ä¢ You have a proven track record of driving measurable impact on pipeline and revenue.

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in executing go-to-market initiatives, such as launching new products or entering new markets.

‚Ä¢ You are fully fluent in English and confident communicating in professional business environments.

‚Ä¢ You are hands-on, pragmatic, and confident taking ownership as the first marketing hire in the company.

‚Ä¢ You are driven by innovative marketing approaches and continuously explore the latest trends, strategies, and growth hacks in B2B marketing.

üå± How We Set You Up to Be Successful:

We don‚Äôt just define what success looks like ‚Äî we actively support you in getting there through a structured, hands-on onboarding process during your first six months with us.

‚Ä¢ Onboarding sessions with your hiring manager to understand your role, goals, and priorities.

‚Ä¢ Onboarding sessions with our CEO and COO to learn about CONROO‚Äôs vision, strategy, and business.

‚Ä¢ HR onboarding covering our values, tools, policies, and processes.

‚Ä¢ A buddy system to support you during your first 2 months.

‚Ä¢ Clear goals for your first 1, 3, and 5 months, with expectations defined from day one so you know how success is measured.

‚Ä¢ We know that starting a new role can be overwhelming. That‚Äôs why we provide clear documentation, a structured to-do list, and role-specific materials to help you get up to speed quickly.

Benefits

üå±About Our Team

We‚Äôre a team of around 30 curious minds working from our offices in Munich and Nuremberg ‚Äî and remotely across Germany. We value ownership and a mindset driven by continuous learning. We take ideas seriously, see them through, and aren‚Äôt afraid to roll up our sleeves when challenges arise. As we grow, we keep raising the bar, looking for smarter, better ways to work ‚Äî and have fun in the process together along the way.

ü§ùWhy Us

üí´ A mission that matters: Be part of a company that‚Äôs working on something meaningful and a purpose you can stand behind.

üèùÔ∏è Workation: Switch up your usual scenery and spend up to 30 days working remotely from a different location.

üëä Witness your actions shape our direction: You‚Äôre given the ownership and trust to make decisions that matter and the results are visible.

üèîÔ∏è Company getaway: Two annual team getaways where we work, unwind, and connect ‚Äî away from the office. We went to the Austrian Alps last year, where should we go next?

üè¢ Multiple office locations: Join us in one of our vibrant offices in Munich, Nuremberg, Hamburg or Duisburg.

üéüÔ∏è Employee discounts: Use our employee discount portal to access attractive deals from top brands across tech, travel, fashion, home, and more ‚Äî online and in-store.

üåç International team: With 10 nationalities across a team of around 30 people, you‚Äôll be part of a naturally diverse environment where different perspectives come together.

üß† Hungry for knowledge? Our monthly S.H.A.R.E sessions teach you something new every month and give you the stage to share your passion & expertise too. If you want to go further, we‚Äôre happy to support you with a course, workshop, or other training opportunities.

Our Recruitment Process - simple, quick, and human.

‚Ä¢ Application review

‚Ä¢ Introduce yourself in a 30-minute call with our People Partner, Hind.

‚Ä¢ Deep dive into your experience in a 45-minute interview with our Founder & CEO, Felix.

‚Ä¢ Raise the bar in a case study and 60-minute interview with our CEO Felix, and COO, Ksenia.

Join us and shape the future of logistics.

title: Head of Brand DACH (m/f/d)
description:
Your tasks

As the Head of Brand DACH (m/f/d) for our core region, you will lead the charge in making KoRo a household name, ensuring that our core brand message ‚Äì everyday feel-good deliciousness ‚Äì is heard loud and clear across all channels.

You will oversee a multidisciplinary team covering Events & Brand Activations, Brand Partnerships, Social Media, and PR. You will be the "internal North Star" and the go-to person for everyone in the company regarding our DACH Brand strategy. Your goal? To make KoRo the most talked-about food brand in the DACH region through Word of Mouth and viral activations.

What you will do:

‚Ä¢ Brand Strategy & Vision: Develop and execute an omni-channel brand strategy that aligns with our commercial goals. You‚Äôll ensure KoRo stays "top of mind" for snackers from Berlin to Vienna to Zurich.

‚Ä¢ Team: Lead and mentor the teams responsible for Social Media, PR, Events, and Brand Activation. You‚Äôll ensure these functions aren't just "doing tasks" but are creating movements.

‚Ä¢ Word of Mouth & Hype: You are responsible for creating "talkability." Whether it‚Äôs a viral social campaign or a massive offline activation, you focus on making people talk about KoRo.

‚Ä¢ Full P&L Ownership: You aren't afraid of the spreadsheet. You will manage the brand budget with a focus on efficiency and ROI, ensuring our "bold ideas" actually make business sense.

‚Ä¢ Omni-channel Leadership: You‚Äôll bridge the gap between our online presence and the physical shelf, ensuring a seamless brand experience regardless of where the customer meets us.

‚Ä¢ Internal Evangelist: You are the primary point of contact for any departments, ensuring that the DACH Brand strategy is integrated into every corner of the business.

Your profile

‚Ä¢ Education: You have completed your studies in International Business, Marketing Management, or Business Administration; other related fields are welcome!

‚Ä¢ Experience: You have at least 6 years of relevant experience working in the DACH Region ‚Äì preferably in the food industry. You have extensive experience in the areas of Brand Management, Marketing (online & offline), Retail, and Expansion

‚Ä¢ Market: You are familiar with DACH culture and snacking habits as well as the DACH e-commerce landscape and consumer behaviour. You understand the cultural nuances of the German, Austrian, and Swiss markets.

‚Ä¢ Languages: You are equipped with excellent German as well as excellent English skills

‚Ä¢ Location: You live in Berlin or the surrounding area, or are willing to relocate

‚Ä¢ Skills:

‚Ä¢ You don‚Äôt just "do" marketing; you live it. You have a deep interest in the business of KoRo and a genuine drive to disrupt the snacking industry.

‚Ä¢ You are highly analytical and comfortable with data

‚Ä¢ You have a track record of bringing "big, crazy ideas" to life.

‚Ä¢ You are passionate about leading a team and helping your employees grow to the best of their abilities

What you can expect from us

‚Ä¢ Our diverse team is ready to be enriched and inspired by your ideas: help building the future of food retailing in our fast-growing start-up!

‚Ä¢ Extensive onboardings which will prepare you for your various and challenging tasks.

‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours and home office options to ensure a good work-life balance.

‚Ä¢ A beautiful and modern office in Berlin Sch√∂neberg, easy to reach by public transport ‚Äì and we cover the costs of your monthly BVG (public transport Berlin) ticket.

‚Ä¢ Find your way (back) to the gym thanks to fitness cooperations with Urban Sports Club or FitX.

‚Ä¢ Optimal performance thanks to a modern MacBook.

‚Ä¢ Well equipped office kitchen with fresh fruit, delicious KoRo snacks, coffee and tea.

‚Ä¢ 20 % discount in our KoRo online store.

‚Ä¢ Regular team events and joint activities as well as legendary company parties.

Sounds good?

Then apply with your application documents (CV and letter of motivation) via the application form on our website. We are looking for real team members ‚Äì let us know who you are and what motivates you!

Please note that, due to the high volume of applications, the position will remain open until February 23.

Everest vereint Finanzwesen, Operations, Personalmanagement und Cloud-Kostensteuerung in einer integrierten Plattform ‚Äì intelligent, automatisiert und aus einer Hand.

Mit 140 Millionen US-Dollar, bereitgestellt von Sutter Hill Ventures, Altimeter Capital, Redpoint Ventures und D1 Capital Partners, sind wir als globales Team an den Standorten Mountain View, Heidelberg, London und Porto Alegre t√§tig.
